name: The Story of "Chess" Trivia Game | Musicals | 15 Questions

questions.text: Where does the first tournament take place?
questions.explanation:
Merano.

	The American cynically joins the natives of Merano in singing the song of the same name.

questions.text: We meet the American's rival, The Russian. Who is the Russian's traveling companion, and what does he do?
options: Molokov is a bodyguard hired by the Russian
questions.explanation:
Molokov is a KGB agent.

	Molokov thinks the American is insane after seeing the latter lose his temper at a press conference. The Russian disagrees, he thinks the whole event was planned.

questions.text: The show's female lead is Florence Vassy. Where is her childhood home?
questions.explanation:
Budapest.

	As a child, Florence escaped the 1956 Hungarian Revolution. The Hungarian Revolution lasted from October 23rd 1956 to November 4th of the same year.

questions.text: What relationship does Florence have to the American?
options: She runs the tournament in which he competes
She is the female champion of the tournament
questions.explanation:
She is his manager.

	Florence is Freddy's caretaker; a sister, manager and second all rolled into one.

questions.text: True or False: The Arbiter, who oversees the chess tournament, can be easily bribed.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The Arbiter is an upstanding referee. He won't be bribed by either women or dope.

questions.text: With whom does Florence eventually fall in love during the show?
questions.explanation:
The Russian.

	While it is implied that the American and Florence have been romantically involved in the past, it is only the Russian that Florence is paired with in the show itself.

questions.text: Complete this lyric from "The American and Florence/Nobody's Side": "Never be the first to believe, Never be the _____ to deceive".
questions.explanation:
last.

	"Nobody's Side" reflects Florence's belief that the only person you can really ever rely on is yourself.

questions.text: According to the Arbiter, when shall a chess game begun at noon end?
questions.explanation:
Six P.M.

	In "Quartet-A Model of Decorum and Tranquility", the Arbiter goes over some of the rules as Molokov, Florence and the Russian discuss the American's brash temper.

questions.text: What does the Russian do after he wins the tournament?
options: He wants the prize money doubled
questions.explanation:
He defects to the U.S.

	In "Anthem", the Russian declares that he is only following his heart by defecting to the U.S.

questions.text: How long after the first tournament does the second tournament begin?
questions.explanation:
One year.

	The second world tournament takes place in Bangkok, where the Russian looks to defend his title against a new challenger.

questions.text: Where is the second tournament held?
questions.explanation:
Bangkok.

	In "One Night in Bangkok", the American tours but ultimately rejects the seedy Bangkok nightlife.

questions.text: According to the American, why is he at the tournament?
options: He is trying to get the Russian to lose
He hopes to win back Florence
questions.explanation:
He's controlling it.

	"And thank God I'm only watching the game, controlling it." The American says this in the song "One Night in Bangkok".

questions.text: Who interviews the Russian on live television?
questions.explanation:
The American.

	The American doesn't ask him anything about the actual tournament. Instead, the American reveals that arrangements have been made to fly the Russian's wife to Bangkok for the deciding match.

questions.text: What is the name of the Russian's wife?
questions.explanation:
Svetlana.

	Florence and Svetlana sing a duet about the Russian: "I Know Him So Well".

questions.text: In the song "Pity the Child", what does the American reflect on?
questions.explanation:
His sad childhood.

	Being the product of a broken home is a major reason for the American's easily ignited temper, which lands him in hot water multiple times during the show.
